thermal_ablation.note_text: Pre-op: RLL SCC, 2.4cm. 8.0 ETT. Navigated to RB6. EBUS confirmed. CBCT verified margins. Microwave ablation: 100W for 10 min. Temp 180C. 3.2cm zone. No bleed. Extubated.

thermal_ablation.note_text:
HISTORY: The patient, a 72-year-old gentleman with significant COPD, presented for ablative therapy of a biopsy-proven RLL squamous cell carcinoma. 
PROCEDURE: Following the administration of general anesthesia, electromagnetic navigation was employed to localize the target in the superior segment. Radial EBUS confirmation was obtained. A microwave ablation catheter was advanced, and thermal energy was delivered at 100 Watts for a duration of 10 minutes. Post-ablation imaging confirmed a satisfactory ablation zone encompassing the lesion with appropriate margins.

thermal_ablation.note_text:
Procedure: Bronchoscopy with Ablation
Attending: Dr. Walsh
Steps:
1. Time out.
2. Induction/ETT.
3. Scope inserted. Airways clear.
4. Navigation to RLL RB6.
5. Radial EBUS check.
6. Microwave probe placed.
7. Ablation: 100W, 10 min.
8. Extubated stable.
Plan: Admit, CXR.

thermal_ablation.note_text: The patient was brought to the bronchoscopy suite for treatment of his right lower lobe cancer. After being put to sleep, we navigated a bronchoscope to the tumor in the superior segment. We double-checked the position with ultrasound and a CT spin. Once we were sure, we inserted the microwave probe and treated the area with high heat for ten minutes. The final scan showed we covered the tumor well. The patient woke up without issues.

Procedure: Bronchoscopic thermal destruction of pulmonary neoplasm.
Target: RLL peripheral nodule.
Method: Electromagnetic guidance utilized to localize zone. Radial ultrasound verified positioning. Microwave energy deployed to coagulate tissue (100W, 600 seconds). Post-destruction imaging validated treatment margins. Airway integrity maintained.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Recurrent endobronchial carcinoid tumor with airway obstruction

code_rationales.31641: Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor (electrocautery/forceps) - dominant code for combined destruction and debulking at the same site.

coding_review.coding_rationale: Dropped 31640 (excision) because it was performed at the same anatomic site (RML) as the ablation (31641). Per coding rules, report only the higher-valued 31641 when both are performed on the same lesion.

code_rationales.31641: Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor via electrocautery - thermal ablation component
code_rationales.31640: Bronchoscopy with excision of tumor - mechanical debulking with rigid forceps at same site (reportable with -59 if distinct work documented)

rvu_summary_2025.bundling_note: 31641 and 31640 at same site may be bundled per NCCI; dominant code is 31641. Use -59 modifier on 31640 only if distinct excision work documented.

thermal_ablation.note_text:
INDICATION: Recurrent endobronchial carcinoid tumor causing significant RML obstruction.
OPERATIVE REPORT: Rigid bronchoscopy was initiated under general anesthesia. A polypoid mass was visualized occluding the RML bronchus. Electrocautery ablation was applied to the tumor base for hemostasis and tissue destruction. Mechanical debridement was subsequently performed using rigid forceps. Excellent anatomical restoration was achieved with widely patent airways.

thermal_ablation.note_text: We performed a rigid bronchoscopy to treat Ms. Jones's airway tumor. Using the rigid scope, we found the tumor blocking the right middle lobe. We used an electric heating tool to burn the tumor and stop any bleeding, then used forceps to pull the tumor out in pieces. By the end, the airway was wide open again. There was very little bleeding, and she woke up safely.

thermal_ablation.note_text: Dx: Metastatic RCC, LMS obstruction. Rigid bronch. APC 60W. Coring/Forceps debulking. Balloon dilation 15-18mm. 50mL pus aspirated. Obstruction 90% -> 30%.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Metastatic RCC with LMS bronchus obstruction

code_rationales.31641: Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor (APC/debulking) - primary therapeutic code covering excision, destruction, and dilation of the tumor.
code_rationales.31645: Therapeutic aspiration of 50mL post-obstructive purulent secretions - distinct therapeutic goal.

coding_review.coding_rationale: Dropped 31640 (excision) and 31630 (dilation) as they targeted the same tumor/site (LMS) as the APC ablation (31641). 31641 is the comprehensive code for tumor destruction/relief of stenosis. 31645 retained for significant purulent aspiration.

code_rationales.31641: Bronchoscopy with destruction of tumor via APC - thermal ablation of endobronchial metastatic tumor
code_rationales.31640: Bronchoscopy with excision of tumor - mechanical debulking is distinct work from ablation (-59 modifier applies)
code_rationales.31630: Bronchoscopy with dilation - balloon dilation of residual stenosis after tumor removal
code_rationales.31645: Bronchoscopy with therapeutic aspiration - removal of 50mL purulent post-obstructive secretions

thermal_ablation.note_text:
CLINICAL SUMMARY: Patient with metastatic renal cell carcinoma presenting with critical left mainstem obstruction.
PROCEDURE: Rigid bronchoscopy was performed via jet ventilation. The LMS was noted to be sub-totally occluded by hemorrhagic tissue. Argon Plasma Coagulation (APC) was utilized for tumor desiccation. Subsequent mechanical coring and forceps extraction yielded significant tumor volume. Balloon angioplasty was performed to address residual stenosis. Copious purulence was evacuated.

thermal_ablation.note_text: Mr. Vision needed urgent clearance of his left main airway due to a tumor. We used a rigid tube to access the airway while he was asleep. We used argon plasma to stop the bleeding and shrink the tumor, then mechanically removed large pieces of it. We also used a balloon to stretch the airway open and suctioned out a lot of infected fluid. He is breathing much better now.

Procedure: Rigid endoscopy with plasma coagulation and luminal recanalization.
Target: Left mainstem metastatic lesion.
Action: Thermal devitalization via APC. Mechanical resection of tissue. Pneumatic dilation of stenosis. Evacuation of purulent secretions. Airway caliber significantly improved.

PROCEDURE: Unilateral Whole Lung Lavage (Left).
INDICATION: Pulmonary Alveolar Proteinosis.
DETAILS: Following general anesthesia and isolation of the left lung via double-lumen endotracheal intubation, serial lavages were performed using warmed saline. PROCEDURE: Bilateral Sequential Whole Lung Lavage.

SUMMARY: Given the severity of disease, a bilateral approach was undertaken. The left lung was lavaged first (20L), followed by repositioning of the DLT and lavage of the right lung (19L). Hemodynamic stability was maintained during the intermission. Total volume instilled: 39L. Significant improvement in gas exchange noted post-procedure.

foreign_body_removal.note_text:
INDICATION: Aspiration of tracheostomy cleaning implement.
PROCEDURE: Flexible bronchoscopy via tracheostomy stoma.
DETAILS: Inspection revealed a plastic bristle cluster impacted in the RML bronchus. A cryoprobe was utilized to adhere to the foreign body, allowing for en bloc extraction. The RML mucosa was noted to be edematous. No residual foreign material remained.

foreign_body_removal.note_text: Dx: Dental crown aspiration LLL. Rigid bronch. Snare removal (forceps failed). Balloon dilation of stenosis. Antibiotics for pneumonia.

clinical_context.primary_indication: Aspirated dental crown with aspiration pneumonia, dysphagia from prior stroke

foreign_body_removal.location: Left lower lobe, posterior basal segment (LB10)

code_rationales.31635: Bronchoscopy with removal of foreign body.
code_rationales.31630: Bronchoscopy with dilation - performed to treat post-extraction stenosis, distinct from extraction itself.

coding_review.coding_rationale: Retained 31630 with modifier -59 as documentation supports dilation as a distinct therapeutic service for post-extraction stenosis/edema, separate from the removal itself.

modifiers: -59 on 31630 if distinct anatomic work documented

code_rationales.31635: Bronchoscopy with removal of foreign body - primary code for extraction of dental crown from LB10
code_rationales.31630: Bronchoscopy with dilation of airway - balloon dilation of post-extraction stenosis in LB10. Reportable as distinct service since dilation was performed to treat mucosal edema/stenosis after foreign body extraction, not as part of the extraction itself.

cpt_summary.coding_notes: 31630 for dilation is typically bundled with 31635 when dilation is performed solely to facilitate foreign body extraction. However, when dilation is performed to treat post-extraction stenosis as a separate therapeutic goal, it may be separately reportable with modifier -59.

rvu_summary_2025.bundling_note: Per NCCI, 31630 may be bundled with 31635 unless distinct anatomic site or separate therapeutic goal is documented. Use -59/-XS modifier when appropriate.

foreign_body_removal.note_text:
INDICATION: Aspiration of dental prosthesis.
PROCEDURE: Rigid and Flexible Bronchoscopy.
NARRATIVE: The patient presented with a metallic foreign body in the LLL. Initial attempts with forceps and basket were unsuccessful due to impaction. A snare device was successfully employed to retrieve the dental crown. Post-extraction stenosis of the segmental bronchus was treated with balloon dilation. Purulent secretions were evacuated.

foreign_body_removal.note_text:
Procedure: FB Removal (Crown)
Steps:
1. Flex scope -> too much pus/impacted.
2. Switched to Rigid.
3. Tried forceps/basket (failed).
4. Snare worked.
5. Pulled crown out.
6. Ballooned the airway (it was swollen).
7. Cleaned out pus.
Plan: Admit for IV abx.
